content.description: Start on the face left of the slabs (facing the river).  Lead up to the large chocked block and move right over the bulge onto the small ledge.  Move up the right of the two cracks up to the tree.  The top 20' or so is blocky and gear is small and available, though tricky in spots.  There is a very rusty historic bolt as you top out to the left of the tree - if setting this up as a TR, bring some trad gear (ex. BD1, BD2, BD3) for the cracks 20' back rather than using the rust.  The tree looks like it has seen better days and could be getting damaged from slinging it, so consider avoiding using it.  (Orginally written by user: Steve Creech)
content.protection: Anchors take BD 1-3, the route itself is stoppers and cams up to BD 1.
content.location: Walk downriver past the "Fools Face" Slab.  10-20' up the trail to setup TRs is the start.  This face faces the river.

content.description: Great climb for beginners and intermediate climbers. Anchors can be accessed from the top but should be backed up by trees due to age. Routes can be lead on trad with a standard rack (~#0.4 -> #2 camalots) and some experience.
content.protection: quick draws for top-rope anchor OR standard rack (~#0.4 -> #2 camalots) for trad
content.location: Hike across the tracks (being careful for trains!). First of two ridges, unmissable slab.

content.description: Low Angle slab with about 4-5 routes, most notable "Fool's Face". Generally done as TR but can be lead with some experience. There are two two-bolted anchors you can top rope from, both with great views of the river. Scramble up the gulley between the Ridge I and Ridge II to access the anchors.
